intro: Luzula comosa var. subsessilis, commonly known as the tufted wood sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its upright, grass-like foliage and compact, cylindrical inflorescences that bear small, spike-like flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable component of ecological studies and horticultural landscapes.
